text: Hans Gasser (2 October 1817 – 24 April 1868) was a painter and sculptor from Austria. Gasser was born in Eisentratten, Krems, Carinthia as the son of the woodworker Jakob Gasser and the younger brother of Joseph Gasser von Valhorn. He was the pupil of Carl Gsellhofer, and became an academy lecturer where he taught Edmund von Hellmer and Carl Schild. He was the father of the sculptor Jakob Nudera. He died in Pest, Hungary. == External links == * Hans Gasser in the RKD Category:1817 births Category:1868 deaths Category:People from Spittal an der Drau Category:19th-century Austrian painters Category:19th-century male artists Category:Austrian male painters
title: Hans Gasser
